Fit Linear model to klassets_xy object

Source: R/xy.R
fit_linear_model.Rd

Fit Linear model to klassets_xy object

Usage

fit_linear_model(df, order = 1, stepwise = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

df

A object from sim_response_xy.

order

Order of predictive variable x.

stepwise

A logical value to indicate to perform stepwise.

verbose

A logical value to indicate to show the trace of the stepwise procedure.

Examples


df <- sim_xy()

df
#> # A tibble: 500 × 2
#>        x     y
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1  1.97  3.23
#>  2  2.08  3.82
#>  3  2.31  4.10
#>  4  2.49  4.42
#>  5  2.50  4.65
#>  6  2.60  4.04
#>  7  2.77  4.93
#>  8  2.88  4.25
#>  9  2.96  3.73
#> 10  2.98  4.85
#> # … with 490 more rows

dflm <- fit_linear_model(df)

dflm
#> # A tibble: 500 × 3
#>        x     y prediction
#>    <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1  1.97  3.23       4.02
#>  2  2.08  3.82       4.07
#>  3  2.31  4.10       4.18
#>  4  2.49  4.42       4.27
#>  5  2.50  4.65       4.28
#>  6  2.60  4.04       4.32
#>  7  2.77  4.93       4.41
#>  8  2.88  4.25       4.46
#>  9  2.96  3.73       4.51
#> 10  2.98  4.85       4.52
#> # … with 490 more rows

plot(dflm)


df <- sim_xy(1000)
df <- dplyr::mutate(df, y = y + 10 * sin(x) + sqrt(abs(x)))

plot(df)


plot(fit_linear_model(df))


plot(fit_linear_model(df, order = 5, stepwise = TRUE, verbose = TRUE))
#> Start:  AIC=-1125.07
#> y ~ x + x_2 + x_3 + x_4 + x_5
#> 
#>        Df Sum of Sq    RSS      AIC
#> <none>              320.76 -1125.07
#> - x_5   1     53.25 374.01  -973.48
#> - x_4   1    131.11 451.87  -784.36
#> - x_3   1    236.05 556.81  -575.53
#> - x     1    288.15 608.91  -486.09
#> - x_2   1    314.99 635.75  -442.96
